_header: Job down the hill he set
Note:
For three related prose versions, see Gray (1974)
XGray, Douglas. “Notes on Some Middle English Charms.” In Chaucer and Middle English Studies in Honour of Rossell Hope Robbins. Beryl Rowland London: Allen and Unwin, 1974, 64-5. Cf. 2952.
_description: A charm for chancre, with Latin instructions for its use — four lines

CamTCC1117.Transcription:
Job doun the hull he seteix wormys hym eteiij were blake &
                    iij were whyte And iij were reede& all þe wormys schole be
                        dedeIn nomine patris & ffilii et spiritus Job doun the hull
                    he seteix wormys hym eteiij were blake & iij were whyte And iij
                    were reede& all þe wormys schole be dedeIn nomine patris
                        & ffilii et spiritus sancti…
CamTCC1117.Attributed Title: ffor the Cankere a good charme (f. 114)
